messageBody:
On 3/24/06, amine achergui <amine.achergui@...> wrote:
>
> Hi folks,
> Is there any test pattern to test a recursive method ( in my case,
> the method's body calls collaborators thus in the test method i use
> mocks).
> Is there any pattern or recipe to solve this?


I'll answer with a different question: are you trying to "white box test"
your function or do you just want to make sure it works?

If the latter, then you shouldn't really care how your method is implemented
(recursively, iteratively, with continuations, etc...). You know that given
a certain input, you expect a certain output and you should write your test
with that in mind.

Now, if you want to "white box test", that's a very different (and
interesting) question. First of all, I would love to know why you
absolutely need to know that recursion is working, but that's just my
personal curiosity.

Without seeing your code, it's hard to give specific advice, but I suspect
that in such case, you are going to need some collaboration from the method
itself so that it can report about the recursion state to your test method
(depth of the stack, iteration level, etc...).

Hope this helped.

--
Cédric
